An intern encrypted the secret using RSA, but carelessly chose n as a product of two Blum integers. Can you recover the flag from this ciphertext? 2997600927216975053061592002609801094393692375626654795703293744598871343597273177425143856174973932526526913898662170731682905259443950447550691542894055

The flag format is flag{...}
n=10443546398574233676632119581002460772924509912495540380043311352790093647509463169909698787209326545759271656356831211514880422873773382332287306583719233, e=5713204981951463923307077157424093827993332737216720391149589055570791430661311168590158137528118685623895535001762580798803157926628412005329834324030199
The lower 104 bits of p are: 18801035815014273691207040912610882519


---

## Challenge Technical Details
flag: flag{ksliif8m}
cipher: RSA
ciphertext: 2997600927216975053061592002609801094393692375626654795703293744598871343597273177425143856174973932526526913898662170731682905259443950447550691542894055
vulnerability: blum integers
hint: Blum integers are products of primes congruent to 3 modulo 4. These integers have unique properties in cryptography.
necessary_info: The flag format is flag{...}
n=10443546398574233676632119581002460772924509912495540380043311352790093647509463169909698787209326545759271656356831211514880422873773382332287306583719233, e=5713204981951463923307077157424093827993332737216720391149589055570791430661311168590158137528118685623895535001762580798803157926628412005329834324030199
The lower 104 bits of p are: 18801035815014273691207040912610882519

extra_info: p=101651225200070775817777499117858749720148519301176784679356638511331351262167, q=102739011536940749427119946636329502241727430859398593928047045764218041644199, Ï†(n)=10443546398574233676632119581002460772924509912495540380043311352790093647509258779672961775684081648313517468104869335564719847495165978648011757190812868
subtype: blum_integers
archetype: rsa
